means: 混合，混入( mingle的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: There was a spring of bitterness mingling with that fountain of sweets.
sentence.Network_cn: 在这个甜蜜的源泉中间,已经掺和进苦涩的山水了.

sentence.Network_en: The mingling of inconsequence belongs to us all.
sentence.Network_cn: 这场矛盾混和物是我们大家所共有的.

sentence.Network_en: And then there came, mingling with his half - formed dreams , a most melancholy caterwauling.
sentence.Network_cn: 后来在他迷迷糊糊 、 似睡非睡的状态中,从外面传来一阵非常凄惨的猫儿叫春的声音.

entry.tran: （声音、气味等）混合，混杂;(感情）交织,交错
entry.def: If things such as sounds, smells, or feelings mingle, they become mixed together but are usually still recognizable.

example.ex: Now the cheers and applause mingled in a single sustained roar...
example.tran: 现在，欢呼声和掌声汇成了一片持续的喧闹声。
他在兴奋的同时又夹杂着一种不祥的预感。

entry.def: At a party, if you mingle with the other people there, you move around and talk to them.

example.ex: Go out of your way to mingle with others at the wedding...
example.tran: 去跟婚礼上的其他人聊聊。

means.word_mean: 1. the action of people mingling and coming into contact;

sentences.sentence: "all the random mingling and idle talk made him hate literary parties"

auth_sentence.content: She enjoyed mingling with fellow Democrats from across the country.
auth_sentence.res_content: She enjoyed mingling with fellow Democrats from across the country.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: She enjoyed mingling with fellow Democrats from across the country.

auth_sentence.content: We see athletes mingling with fans, and handing out autographs.

auth_sentence.content: Piers Morgan was mingling as if his life depended on it.
auth_sentence.res_content: Piers Morgan was mingling as if his life depended on it.
